DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to evaluate whether a quarterly feedback, education and performance improvement site-based intervention has a greater impact on quality performance and adherence to evidenced-based guidelines than existing on-demand feedback. This study will use a randomized design to compare changes in quality performance and adherence to selected measures among hospitals using existing on-demand reports and general quality improvement (QI) efforts versus those receiving intensive, targeted QI feedback via reports, teleconferences, webinars, and specialized tool kits.
DOC.brief_title: Centers for Education on Research and Therapeutics - Heart Failure: Targeted Intervention Study
DOC.criteria: All sites participating in Get With the Guidelines Heart Failure. Sites in Get With the Guidelines Heart Failure which opt out of participation.
